intro: Oxalis kamiesbergensis, commonly known as the Kamiesberg wood sorrel, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive red or purple veining, and it produces small, delicate flowers in shades of yellow or orange. The plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in rocky outcrops and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
